«Игра, которая заслуживает сиквел»

Nominated for "I'm Not Crying, There's Something In My Eye” Award.

Why ? Three reasons:

1) Because of the game ending.
2) Because we will most likely never get Half-Life 2: Episode Three.
3) Because we will most likely never get Half-Life 3.

Looks like I will have to hope that at least my grandchildren will have the privilege to be alive when the next game is finally released.

THE “GAME THAT DESERVES A SEQUEL” AWARD

Half life 2 is my favorite video game and video game series and I can't recommend it enough. Even though it is 10 years old it still stands up to games being released today. I can't wait until Half life 3 is released as it will be even more proof that every game valve releases is absolutely groundbreaking and sets the new standard for developers everywhere.

This installment of the series does an impeccable job introducing players to the mysteries and plot points that will presumably continue to shape the trajectory of the overall story following the climactic end of Half Life 2. Like effectively everyone else who's played the games. I'm still quite avidly awaiting its sequel in spite of the delay.

GAME THAT DESERVES A SEQUEL

Из всей линейки Half-Life меня больше всего впечатлила именно эта часть. Сама по себе игра проверена временем и множеством восторженных пользователей. На мой взгляд, она наиболее интригующа и динамична сюжетом, в сравнении с другими частями. Так же стала лучше и графика. Появилось больше моментов, в которых нужно думать, а не просто сломя голову бежать вперед.

Единственный минус, не то что-бы конкретно этой игры, а всей линейки в том, что так и не вышел третий эпизод или третья часть. Игра обрывается на самом интересном моменте.

This is a GAME THAT DESERVES A SEQUEL. Having done my duty, I'll play devil's advocate and give Valve & co. credit for not just throwing out cash grab sequels. Just as long as they don't forget to, y'know, ACTUALLY FINISH WHAT THEY STARTED!

But for a real review, yes, buy 'em, play 'em (in order natch).  They really are good.
Game deserves a sequel.
